topic.title: here's an example why you should never use a surveillance coin like Bitcoin

1610676192_1Eh9Nzq2eMP62VExTCTSyPD46aKWq.body:
> [deuxzaron](#comment_56_1M1U9ZvF9XJmt4oPY4TLBWHJZWDdRpXFFy): Wouldn't it make more sense to use unknown wallet addresses for someshit like that?

yes it would , but a lot better than that is using a more advanced anonymous cryptocurrency like Monero

> [freemankind](#comment_63_17AwNLQUY1CRAb1U6jVJhvVUnyEdNvkiue): bitcoin is meant to be a censor-proof anyone who tells you otherwise is not a friend

a censor-proof of what you have....for chainanalysis and the whole world

> [maysomusician](#comment_2_1AwyDwjc1hftxycY2WXYjhwZWQdwEAsB1J): What made you regard Bitcoin as anonymous coin... It's ideologically basically just decentralized, anyone can inspect when, who and how much did you pay for.

i have never regarded Bitcoin as an anonymous coin but rather as unusable old tech

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_226_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): I you want anonymous turn to zCash

ZCash is not fungible and therefore only "half anonymous" :)

> [freemankind](#comment_69_17AwNLQUY1CRAb1U6jVJhvVUnyEdNvkiue): we shall call you judas :)

yeah call me Judas and stick to BTC and have fun sharing your payments with chainanalysis (and possibly finding yourself in KYC traps)

1610256866_1LWUniEdUPZrEqFD3Yj9tpqkQNnfs.body: Bitcoin: great invention in 2009, shitty overvalued trash in 2021

> [volkon](#comment_6_1DWYNPAmxeKc5Brcs1Yi6oyjndj53kPeLP): Typical no-coiner comment.

typical Bitcoin maximalist reply?
